title: Kim Jiyoung, Born 1982
author: Cho Nam-Joo
thoughts: Very intriguing and a bit sad. It was Fiction that could have easily been Non-Fiction.

title: The Age of AI
author: Henry Kissinger, Eric Schmidt, Daniel Huttenlocher
thoughts: A lot of this I have gone over in my AI class. Might skip few chapters.

title: Fashion and Cultural Studies (2nd. Edition)
author: Susan B. Kaiser, Denise N. Green
thoughts: Had to read for a class. Probably not going to open again.

title: Persuasion
author: Jane Austen
thoughts: The text is not easy to read or follow. I started listening to the audiobook, but haven’t visited in a while. Would have to restart the book to continue.

title: I Know Why The Caged Bird Sings
author: Maya Angelou
thoughts: Haven't started but want to read. Need to be in the right headspace to deal with heavy topics.

title: Mansfield Park
author: Jane Austen
thoughts: Honestly don't really want to read. Just bought it second-hand in order to start educating myself on Austen's work.

title: The Blind Assassin
author: Margaret Atwood
thoughts: A Christmas gift from my mother 2 years ago. I like the author but this book isn't tempting me at the moment.

title: David and Goliath
author: Malcolm Gladwell
thoughts: I read this a while ago. My second Gladwell book and I thought it was interesting.

title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century
author: Yuval Noah Harari
thoughts: I've heard a lot about this and people have suggested it. I got this from my sister after she read it and I'm planning to read when I start liking non-fiction again.

title: 365 Days of Art
author: Lorna Scobie
thoughts: Got this as a present from a family friend. Kinda corny but sweet. Not sure if I'll start working on it because it seems like a commitment. Maybe if I get really bored.

title: The Worlds Best Poems
author: Mark Van Doren, Garibaldi M. Lapolla
thoughts: Found this on the street for free. Cool to have at home.

title: A Confederacy of Dunces
author: John Kennedy Toole
thoughts: Started reading and think it's funny. The text is not the easiest to read so maybe I'll continue when I have more energy.

title: Slaugtherhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
thoughts: I read this 11th grade for a class. I didn't get it back then, but now I kinda want to revisit.

title: Meaty
author: Samantha Irby
thoughts: Found at Strand for a dollar. Thought it was funny but kinda outdated and not too intriguing.

title: Last Summer in the City
author: Gianfranco Calligarich
thoughts: Next book on the list. Perfect for vacation.

title: The Inferno
author: Dante Alighieri
thoughts: Maybe going to read a few passages. Found at the bins.

title: Camus and Sartre: Crisis and Commitment
author: Germaine Brée
thoughts: Not going. Looks good on the shelf.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
thoughts: I finished this a year ago within a week. Captivating and heart-wrenching. A great distraction and the movie is good too, but not as good.

title: Easy Pasta
author: Parragon Books, LLC
thoughts: Planning on cooking recipes.

title: Säkenöivät ja Oikukkaat: Suomen Kultakauden Naisia
author: Hanna-Reetta Screck
thoughts: Got as a Christmas present from my grandparents. Tells stories of influential Finnish women. Should probably educate myself but just not in the mood at the moment.

title: Thug Kitchen: Eat Like You Give a Fuck
author: Thug Kitchen, LLC
thoughts: Did a few recipes. Cringe book with good vegan recipes.

title: The Frog Commissary Cookbook
author: Steven Poses, Anne Clark, Becky Roller
thoughts: Bought at the bins for the illustrations.

title: Living Architecture Issue No.8: Sacndinavian Design
author: Living Architecture
thoughts: Bought at the bins just for fun.

title: Wonderland
author: Annie Lebovitz
thoughts: Got it as a present. I have skimmed through. More of a decorative element than a sit-down-and-read type book.

title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas: A Savage Journey to the Heart of the American Dream
author: Hunter S. Thompson
thoughts: Library book that was on her list for a while. Won't read again but good.

title: The Dinner
author: Herman Koch
thoughts: Read in three days. Bought at the airport and is amazing.

title: In Search of the Lost Chord: 1967 and the Hippie Idea
author: Danny Goldberg
thoughts: This book is from the library. It was acquired for research purposes for a paper about hippie culture.

title: Naked Lunch
author: William S. Burroughs
thoughts: This book is from the library. It was acquired for research purposes for a paper about hippie culture.
